data.description: Analyzes aggregate growth, income distribution and poverty in lower income economies. Uses microeconomics of imperfect labor, capital and insurance markets to explore why some individuals advance economically as their economies grow and others fall behind. Considers implications of aggregate and micro analysis for national and international economic policy.
data.title: ECONOMIC PROBLEMS OF DEVELOPING AREAS

data.description: Introduction to economic ways of thinking about a wide range of problems and issues. Topics include consumption, production, prices, markets, finance, trade, pollution, growth, farms, taxes, and development.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO AGRICULTURAL AND APPLIED ECONOMICS
